divs: sighting detailsmy son and i were driving towards graham, tx, on hwy 380 about 3 miles out of graham proper. i am an avid night sky watcher so when i noticed an extremely bright star\planet about 40��� above the horizon to the northwest, i was surprised. i indicated it to my son and told him that's got to be a planet because of the brightness, but i'd never remembered seeing such a bright light in that part of the sky at this time of the year. as we got into graham and stopped for gas (about 4 minutes from first sighting it) i noticed that the light had turned pink\red as it would do if it were getting lower to the horizon and atmospherics colored it a bit. about two minutes after that it vanished and unless it's the fastest planet in the solar system i don't know what it could have been. i've just now used an interactive sky chart and there is nothing there that could have explained it (note: constellation lynx is close to where it was). there was no obvious movement, just the rapid color changes and the apparent disappearance of the object\star\planet. end of report.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Graham
There were no other sightings in Graham on or around September 27th 2008
Summary: Looked like an extremely bright star/planet, white going to red
